answers.answer: Work out more :)  LOL just kidding :)  I am a type 1 but I had a similar problem when I was diagnosed and I am not sure if it applies to type 2 or not.  Here is the issue.  If your body does not have the carbs and stored fat that it needs or can not recognize it if it is there your body will burn stored fat and MUSCLE to gain the energy that it needs to maintain the work levels you are placing on it.  SO you might be actually going very low in your sugar levels when you are working out and defeating some of your progress.  I would suggest testing before during and after working out to see what your level are doing.  I know that few type 2's actually test several times a day like we do but in your case you might gain some additional information to make adjustments you need to gain back the muscle.  In my case I take lots of sugar before I work out and that maintains the right level.  Not sure if it would work the same for a type 2.

question: I am a 44 year male and was diagonosed with type 2 diabetes about 4 years ago.  I have notice a great loss in muscle in my legs and shoulders.  what should I do to correct this?
title: diabetes and muscle loss
